intro: Helianthemum rhodax, commonly known as the pink rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing shrub that typically reaches heights of about 30 centimeters. The plant produces showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are small, leathery, and covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Helianthemum rhodax is well adapted to rocky and dry environments, making it a hardy and drought-tolerant species.
